alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Mineral (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 10:34AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: A Period of Snow Expected Late This Afternoon and Evening... Snow is expected most likely between 3 PM and 8 PM this afternoon into this evening. Accumulations around an inch to perhaps two inches are expected during this time for elevations above 2500 feet with temperatures around 30 to 32 degrees. The ridges along Interstate 68 will be impacted by the snowfall and surfaces may become snow covered and slippery. Use caution when driving. For lower elevations below 2500 feet. Snow may mix with rain and a slushy coating is possible with temperatures slightly above freezing. Snowfall rates will decrease later this evening with temperatures near or slightly above freezing for most areas before a steadier snow arrives toward Monday morning with additional accumulations around 1 to 3 inches most likely through Monday afternoon. Temperatures will fall below freezing during this time, causing snow covered and slippery surfaces.
